mixtral-8x7b_direct_sole-planning_result:
Day 1 (March 7): Departure from Wichita to Alamosa

* Self-driving from Wichita to Alamosa: duration: 8 hours 27 mins, distance: 819 km, cost: 40
* Arrival in Alamosa and check-in at a hotel (cost: $150 per night)

Day 2-3 (March 8-9): Exploring Alamosa

* Accommodation: Hotel (cost: $150 per night)
* Activities: Great Sand Dunes National Park, San Luis Valley Scenic Byway, and local attractions (cost: $200 per day)

Day 4-5 (March 10-11): Traveling from Alamosa to Grand Junction

* Self-driving from Alamosa to Grand Junction: duration: 4 hours 29 mins, distance: 396 km, cost: 19
* Accommodation: Hotel (cost: $150 per night)
* Activities: Visiting the Colorado National Monument, Downtown Grand Junction, and local attractions (cost: $200 per day)

Day 6-7 (March 12-13): Traveling from Grand Junction to Durango

* Self-driving from Grand Junction to Durango: duration: 3 hours 33 mins, distance: 269 km, cost: 13
* Accommodation: Hotel (cost: $150 per night)
* Activities: Visiting Mesa Verde National Park, the Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad, and local attractions (cost: $200 per day)

Return (March 14): Self-driving from Durango to Wichita

* Duration: 11 hours 15 mins, distance: 1,078 km, cost: 53

Total Cost for Travel: $1,269
Remaining Budget for Activities and Food: $4,631

Notes:

* This plan takes into consideration the provided travel dates and budget. The itinerary includes self-driving to save on transportation costs and visit 3 cities in Colorado.
* Accommodation costs are based on an average of $150 per night for a hotel room, while activities cost around $200 per day depending on the chosen attractions and experiences.
* It is recommended to research specific hotels, restaurants, and activities to make the most out of your budget and travel experience.
